results.title: Apollo 10: prelude to the moon landing
results.brief_description: Depicts the “dress rehearsal” of the Apollo 11 flight with astronauts Stafford, Young and Cernan. This mission supplied information to assist the Apollo 11 moon landing and the film contains the first colour television shot in space and shows the spacecraft nine miles from the lunar surface.
results.description: Depicts the “dress rehearsal” of the Apollo 11 flight with astronauts Stafford, Young and Cernan. results.title: Aplekage: the art of Stewart Merrett
results.creator_credit: Trevor George Lucas, Andromeda Productions, Dunkirk Traders and Russell Hurley
results.brief_description: Stewart Merrett works in a fabric art form that is colourful, understandable and very popular. He likes to think that people who call themselves artists can actually draw, that they have some intrinsic craft.

results.title: Aphids
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Deals with periods in the life-history of the common plant louse; close-ups show the insect laying eggs, moulting and feeding. A time-lapse study is used to show wing development; microcinematography shows details of the insect’s beck.

results.title: Apemen of Africa
results.brief_description: The processes involved in pinpointing the appearance of humans on earth are discussed in this film. Fossils discovered in South Africa in 1924 bore evidence that humans first appeared in Africa, not Asia, contrary to prevailing scientific opinion. Shows how further discoveries by anthropologists proved without doubt the existence of a human-like creature who lived in Africa as long as three and a half million years ago. Narrated by E. G. Marshall

results.title: Aorere: an attempt at change
results.creator_credit: Zero Sixteen Films and Department of Education, New Zealand
results.brief_description: The headmaster of Aorere College in South Auckland, New Zealand, believes that the resources of secondary schools should be used more completely. Shows the ways in which other members of the community share the facilities of Aorere College.

results.title: Anzac: a nation's heritage
results.brief_description: The ANZAC performance at Gallipoli is examined as are the towns that are there today and the graves that remain. Likens the ANZACS to the Greek heroes of ancient times. This is an edited version of a commemorative film made in 1965, 50 years after the landing of Australian and New Zealand troops at Gallipoli on April 25th, 1915. Highlights include memorial services in Australia, New Zealand and Britain, a re-enactment at Anzac Cove and scenes of Gallipoli and Troy today.

results.title: Anzac Day: World War 1 (Yrs 9-11)
results.brief_description: Presented by Richard Morecroft, this program looks at empire building alliances and events which led to the start of World War I. It presents the romance of war, life and death at Gallipoli and Australian campaigns in the Sinai desert and in Europe.
